title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 22 June 2015 - XWiki
content:
<xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
12:39 <cjd> has quit  
13:21 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
13:42 <MasterPiece> has joined #xwiki  
15:00 <tmortagne> has quit  
15:02 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
15:02 <Enygma`> has quit  
15:03 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
15:38 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
16:07 <MasterPiece> has quit  
16:27 <quanttrom> has joined #xwiki  
16:29 <quanttrom> I am getting an error when I try to import XAR files from v6.3 to v7.1.1. I am currently trying to migrate a working wiki to a new machine.  Variety of macros are not working I am not sure where to begin debugging. Any help/questions are appreciated.  
16:30 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
16:34 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
16:34 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
16:35 <vmassol> has quit  
16:45 <tmortagne> quanttrom: you are getting error during import of you get error in pages after the import ?  
16:48 <quanttrom> tmortagne: it says "error during import" but lists no errors underneath the message. After import the pages have error in them. Missing macros. etc. I will link to a screenshot  
16:48 <vmassol1> cool I can create a doc in a nested space (using a velocity script) and then access it from the URL :) first step!  
16:48 <tmortagne> the standard import UI is not great for error reporting...  
16:49 <vmassol1> Enygma`: cool that you're taking XWIKI-12229 ;)  
16:50 <vmassol1> is now known as <vmassol>  
16:50 <vmassol> once this issue is fixed we'll be able to create nested spaces docs from the UI (by typing directly the URL)  
16:50 <Enygma`> vmassol: hah, actually I read it too quickly and confused it with the create UI :)  
16:51 <Enygma`> but it should be related still  
16:51 <vmassol> yes this one has to be done for 7.2M1 while the UI counterpart could be done for M2  
16:52 <vmassol> now indeed, we can consider thy're related ;) still good you're taking it :)  
16:53 <vmassol> Enygma`: do we have a jira for modifying Add Page/Add Space?  
16:54 <vmassol> apparently not  
16:54 <vmassol> cannot see it in http://design.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Proposal/NestedSpaces  
16:54 <Enygma`> no, am creating one now  
16:54 <vmassol> ok  
16:54 <Enygma`> I saw the create action issue and thought that was it :D  
16:55 <vmassol> :)  
16:55 <msmeria> has quit  
16:56 <Enygma`> so is there a conclusion about the create space UI? Are we dropping it and presenting only documents?  
16:56 <Enygma`> or it's still unclear?  
16:56 <vmassol> unclear  
16:56 <Enygma`> awesome  
16:56 <vmassol> someone (you?) need to make us converge  
16:56 <vmassol> :)  
16:56 <Enygma`> even better! :)  
16:56 <vmassol> haven't seen anyone against dropping add space so far  
16:56 <vmassol> but there could eb  
16:57 <vmassol> not veryone has expressed their opinion  
16:57 <Enygma`> well, nobody is saying it directly, but indirectly there is still friction  
16:57 <vmassol> it's important that for all design decisions we do them in M1  
16:57 <Enygma`> NS vs ND  
16:57 <vmassol> this is a bit different  
16:57 <vmassol> dropping add space could be done even now possibly  
16:58 <vmassol> but yes we need to start deciding about what ND means compared to NS (in the UI)  
17:00 <Enygma`> yeah, because IMO, dropping the create space UI is what makes the difference between NS and ND, since you can`t just drop the add UI without dropping the differentiated display of pages and spaces  
17:03 <quanttrom> tmortagne: http://i.imgur.com/PvmjHMT.png http://i.imgur.com/62OsoGG.png  
17:04 <tmortagne> quanttrom: this screenshot sounds like missing translation document, how does the import error looks like exactly ?  
17:04 <eromano> has joined #xwiki  
17:04 <tmortagne> do you get a list of failing page or a big error ?  
17:04 <tmortagne> s/page/pages/  
17:05 <quanttrom> no failing page. no error. Just a list of pages that were successfully imported  
17:07 <tmortagne> quanttrom: you told me that you where getting error during import  
17:07 <eromano> Hi. I've got a problem where I try to hit a page (Admin's preferences page... trying to toggle hidden documents) and xwiki just kills itself, no log message, nothing...  
17:07 <eromano> Is there a way to set verbose logging on all levels?  
17:08 <tmortagne> eromano: it's not going to help you much I think since it's going to be so verbose that whatever you find search will be totally drowned  
17:08 <tmortagne> s/find search/search/  
17:08 <quanttrom> tmortagne:  the error is show in the screenshot. It says "Importing software home.xar: Error while importing" but no errors listed below  
17:08 <quanttrom> http://i.imgur.com/lidvRBD.png  
17:09 <tmortagne> ha sorry I clicked on the second screenshot and did not even saw the first one that was just there...  
17:09 <eromano> tmortagne: what would you suggest I do next  
17:10 <Enygma`> eromano: if you suspect something in particular, you might try http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Logging+Application and enable detailed logging there.  
17:10 <eromano> Yeah, I'm not sure where the problem would be, though... I tried enabling a few modules, but nothing.  
17:10 <Enygma`> are you sure it`s not a JVM crash?  
17:10 <tmortagne> eromano: the JVM is completely killed without anything ?  
17:11 <eromano> I'll reproduce it one more time, but yes, that's what it looks like.  
17:11 <eromano> (It's when I go to Admin's profile, and attempt to edit the page in any form)  
17:12 <eromano> object editor, page editor, etc... and it's when I click on edit - I can't get to the page at all  
17:13 <tmortagne> quanttrom: enabling debug log in com.xpn.xwiki.web.ImportAction might give more details or what is this error about, see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Logging+Application for how to enabled debug log on some class/logger  
17:13 <quanttrom> tmortagne: will look into it right now. thanks  
17:14 <tmortagne> but if all the document are listed as imported it's probably some minor issue  
17:15 <tmortagne> now for http://i.imgur.com/62OsoGG.png on which page was this screenshot taken ?  
17:17 <quanttrom> main page  
17:17 <tmortagne> the screenshot seems to suggest that the page WikiManager.Translations is missing or has been saved with a user not having expected rights  
17:17 <Enygma`> eromano: What JVM are you using? If there's a bug in the JVM, it`s outside of our control. Try using a diferent JVM, preferably Oracle's.  
17:18 <tmortagne> quanttrom: did you restared since your import ?  
17:18 <tmortagne> the issue with one bug XAR is that pages can be imported in any order and some pages require some other at the moment they are created  
17:18 <tmortagne> that might be your issue here  
17:19 <tmortagne> for example translation document need to have as author author a user which have admin right in this translation case  
17:19 <tmortagne> a restart will fix all that  
17:19 <tmortagne> if that's the issue  
17:20 <tmortagne> sorry I have to go, good luck  
17:22 <quanttrom> tmortagne: thanks !  
17:22 <quanttrom> I appreciate your help ! :)  
17:24 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
17:24 <tmortagne> has quit  
17:31 <gsmeria> has quit  
17:44 <vmassol> @evalicar: regarding the support drop for IE8/9, how does it affect extensions, e.g. http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/IDEAS-37 ?  
17:44 <vmassol> s/evalicar/evalica  
17:47 <evalica> I commented on the issue  
17:47 <vmassol> k  
17:47 <vmassol> but but...  
17:47 <vmassol> commenting  
17:48 <evalica> I don't know… the conclusion was that we don't fix the issues in priority, but we didn't agree to close them as Won't fix, since the usage is still good  
17:48 <vmassol> commented  
17:50 <vmassol> commented again  
17:50 <vmassol> so I believe your comment was not correct :)  
17:50 <vmassol> do you agree?  
17:51 <evalica> yes - I was looking at the pom too  
17:51 <evalica> you are right … we cannot close issues on extensions on browser support agrement  
17:51 <evalica> until they change dependency or case by case  
17:51 <vmassol> we could say that once an extension requires XWiki 7.0+ then it can drop support of IE8/9  
17:51 <vmassol> WDYT?  
17:52 <evalica> yes  
17:52 <vmassol> ok adding to the brwoser support page  
17:52 <evalica> ty  
17:52 <vmassol> I hope everyone agrees :)  
17:53 <vmassol> mflorea, tm   
17:53 <vmassol> Enygma`, gdelhumeau  
17:53 <vmassol> agreed?  
17:54 <mflorea> +1  
17:55 <gdelhumeau> sounds legit  
18:00 <Enygma`> makes sense  
18:01 <vmassol> k cool  
18:02 <Enygma`> though there is also the case when an extension does not have to actually do anything to "upgrade" to 7.0+ but no longer wants to support IE8/9. It would be a decision of the individual extension to drop support and move forward, following XE, but without introducing a technical limitation through some dependency.  
18:03 <Enygma`> so we can also decide for some (/most/all) extensions to just make the step, without adding any dep.  
18:03 <vmassol> a contrib extension can do whatever it wants  
18:03 <Enygma`> exactly  
18:04 <woshilapin> has quit  
18:04 <Enygma`> so it can drop support even \*before\* it requires some feature available only in XE 7.0+  
18:04 <vmassol> we're just talking about suggesstions of best practices here  
18:04 <vmassol> it can even have bugs :)-  
18:04 <vmassol> (or not work)  
18:05 <Enygma`> yep  
18:05 <vmassol> I'll reword a bit  
18:05 <Enygma`> well, once it does depend on 7.0+ and important bugs need to be backported, then I guess it will need to use a bugfix branch as well.  
18:06 <vmassol> no need to reword  
18:06 <vmassol> I have used "should" which I think is good enough  
18:22 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
18:34 <ClemensR> has quit  
18:41 <Bugen\_do> has joined #xwiki  
18:50 <cjd> has quit  
19:01 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
19:37 <evalica> has quit  
19:39 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
19:39 <evalica> has quit  
19:45 <Enygma`> has quit  
20:00 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
20:01 <Slashman> has quit  
20:02 <mflorea> has quit  
20:41 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
20:51 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
21:55 <quanttrom> hello, I am trying to import a XAR file that is 46MB. I have changed the "Maximum Upload size" in XWikiPreferences  but the import still tells me the file has to be under 32 MB. Any ideas?  
22:15 <vmassol> has quit  
22:37 <cjd> has quit  
22:39 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
22:48 <Bugen\_do> has quit  
22:49 <eromano> has quit  
23:54 <ansuz> has quit  
23:54 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
23:54 <ansuz> has joined #xwiki
